oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Walter White Theatre
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Walter White Theatre. The first movie shown was "Mexican Bull Fight." There is a cutout of a bull and a matador in front of the building.

Nickelodeons were the first type of indoor theaters for porjected motion pictures. Popular in the early 1900s and 1910s, nickelodeons were usually small, simple theaters, usually set up in converted storefronts. Movie-goers could get admission to the theaters for five cents. Nickelodeons are synonymous with the emergence of American cinema.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Movie theaters
